title: 113_s2960
content: Rental assistance for homeless or at-risk Indian veterans. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to include an Indian veterans housing rental assistance program, with definitions for "Indian" and "Indian area" provided. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to include an Indian veterans housing rental assistance program, with definitions for "Indian" and "Indian area" provided. The Secretary may use up to 5 percent of rental assistance funds for a program benefiting Indian veterans in conjunction with the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Indian veterans housing rental assistance program, modeled on existing programs, aims to help homeless or at-risk Indian veterans near Indian areas. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may make modifications to facilitate the program's use by Indian grant recipients. The rental assistance program for Indian veterans is designed to aid homeless or at-risk individuals near Indian areas. Recipients eligible for grants under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 can receive rental assistance based on need, administrative capacity, and other criteria set by the Secretary. The rental assistance program for Indian veterans is administered in accordance with the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996. Grantees must submit reports on the utilization of rental assistance and provide information to the Secretary. The rental assistance program for Indian veterans, administered under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, requires grantees to provide information to the Secretary for program assessment. The Secretary must consult with tribal organizations to ensure effective delivery of rental assistance and supportive services to eligible individuals. The Secretary may waive or specify alternative requirements for rental assistance under this subparagraph if necessary for effective delivery. The Secretary may waive or specify alternative requirements for rental assistance under this subparagraph to Indian veterans, except for provisions related to labor standards or the environment.
